definition: make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
example: the exorbitant cost of land in urban areas only exacerbated the problem

definition: a specialized segment of the market for a particular kind of product or service.
example: he believes he has found a niche in the market

definition: walk in a leisurely way.
example: I strolled around the city
synonyms: ['saunter', 'amble', 'wander', 'meander', 'ramble', 'dawdle', 'promenade', 'walk', 'go for a walk', 'take a walk', 'roam', 'traipse', "stretch one's legs", 'get some exercise', 'get some air', 'take the air']

definition: not justified or authorized.
example: I am sure your fears are unwarranted

definition: a discernible change in opinion, especially the amount by which votes or points scored change from one side to another.
example: a five per cent swing to Labour

definition: ostentatiously costly and luxurious.
example: the opulent comfort of a limousine

definition: be on each or on one side of.
example: the three defendants stood in the dock, flanked by police officers

definition: an act of swinging.
example: with the swing of her arm, the knife flashed through the air

definition: an approach or proposal made to someone with the aim of opening negotiations or establishing a relationship.
example: he began making overtures to British merchant banks

definition: feel or show great joy or delight.
example: we spent the evening rejoicing at our victory

definition: money.
example: they wanted to spend their newly acquired brass

definition: a sleep-inducing drug.
example: hypnotics may be prescribed

definition: push suddenly or violently in a specified direction.
example: she thrust her hands into her pockets

definition: to an unwarranted degree; inordinately.
example: there is no need to be unduly alarmed

definition: place (something) in a niche.
example: these elements were niched within the shadowy reaches

definition: an introduction to something more substantial.
example: the talks were no more than an overture to a long debate

definition: (in art or literature) construction or creation from a diverse range of available things.
example: the chaotic bricolage of the novel is brought together in a unifying gesture

definition: (chiefly of aircraft) designed in accordance with technology which makes detection by radar or sonar difficult.
example: a stealth bomber

definition: a long weapon with a wooden shaft and a pointed steel head, formerly used by a horseman in charging.
example: the warriors bore lances tipped with iron or steel

definition: an arrival or entry of large numbers of people or things.
example: a massive influx of tourists

definition: outstandingly bad; shocking.
example: egregious abuses of copyright

definition: a short leisurely walk.
example: we took a stroll in the garden

definition: people in authority or of high military rank.
example: the top brass of the Jockey Club

definition: prick or cut open (an abscess or boil) with a lancet or other sharp instrument.
example: abscesses should not be lanced until there is a soft spot in the centre

definition: (of hair, fur, or skin) smooth and glossy.
example: he was tall, with sleek, dark hair

definition: a yellow alloy of copper and zinc.
example: a brass plate on the door

definition: a risky or daring journey or undertaking.
example: pioneering ventures into little-known waters

definition: shift or cause to shift from one opinion, mood, or state of affairs to another.
example: opinion swung in the Chancellor's favour
synonyms: ['change', 'fluctuate', 'oscillate', 'waver', 'alternate', 'see-saw', 'yo-yo', 'vary', 'shift', 'alter', 'undulate', 'ebb and flow', 'rise and fall', 'go up and down', 'go back and forth']

definition: undertake a risky or daring journey or course of action.
example: she ventured out into the blizzard

definition: capable of working successfully; feasible.
example: the proposed investment was economically viable
synonyms: ['workable', 'feasible', 'practicable', 'practical', 'applicable', 'usable', 'manageable', 'operable', 'operational', 'possible', 'within the bounds/realms of possibility', 'within reach', 'within reason', 'likely', 'achievable', 'attainable', 'accomplishable', 'realizable', 'reasonable', 'sensible', 'realistic', 'logical', 'useful', 'of use', 'serviceable', 'suitable', 'expedient', 'effective', 'valid', 'tenable']

definition: make (hair) smooth and glossy.
example: her black hair was sleeked down

definition: not even or regular in pattern or movement; unpredictable.
example: her breathing was erratic

definition: move or cause to move in a smooth, curving line.
example: she swung her legs to the side of the bed

definition: achieve a sporting victory without effort.
example: the horse strolled home by 12 lengths

definition: play music with a flowing but vigorous rhythm.
example: the band swung on

definition: a rock or boulder that differs from the surrounding rock and is believed to have been brought from a distance by glacial action.
example: the source of stone for the whetstones may have been glacial erratics

definition: a bell or a metal bar or tube, tuned and used in a set to produce a melodious series of ringing sounds when struck.
example: the warm breeze whispered through the chimes hanging from the balcony ceiling

definition: be in agreement with.
example: his poem chimes with our modern experience of loss
synonyms: ['accord', 'correspond', 'be consistent', 'be compatible', 'agree', 'be in agreement', 'be in accordance', 'fit in', 'be in harmony', 'harmonize', 'be in tune', 'be consonant', 'be similar']

definition: implore (someone) to do something.
example: she conjured him to return

definition: fix with cement.
example: wooden posts were cemented into the ground

definition: move by grasping a support from below and leaping.
example: we swung across like two trapeze artists

definition: coming or happening later than should have been the case.
example: a belated apology

definition: make (a garment or piece of fabric) using crochet.
example: she had crocheted the shawl herself

definition: the propulsive force of a jet or rocket engine.
example: the engine was a Russian-built Nene of higher thrust than the original models

definition: a formal curse by a pope or a council of the Church, excommunicating a person or denouncing a doctrine.
example: the Pope laid special emphasis on the second of these anathemas

definition: having an external cause or origin.
example: technological changes exogenous to the oil industry

definition: a comfortable or suitable position in life or employment.
example: he is now head chef at a leading law firm and feels he has found his niche

definition: relating to or producing hypnosis.
example: a hypnotic state

definition: a shallow recess, especially one in a wall to display a statue or other ornament.
example: each niche holding a shepherdess in Dresden china

definition: brass wind instruments (including trumpet, horn, and trombone) forming a band or a section of an orchestra.
example: the brass were consistently too loud

definition: an inflow of water into a river, lake, or the sea.
example: the lakes are fed by influxes of meltwater

definition: nauseous; feeling sick.
example: in the morning he was still pale and queasy

definition: a confused mixture.
example: a mishmash of outmoded ideas

definition: (in bookbinding) paste a single page, typically an illustration, to the neighbouring page of a book by a thin line of paste down its inner margin.
example: tipped in here is a clipping from a magazine

definition: cause (a spirit or ghost) to appear by means of a magic ritual.
example: they hoped to conjure up the spirit of their dead friend

definition: a feeling of smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one's achievements.
example: the figures are better, but there are no grounds for complacency

definition: (of a person or wrongful act, especially a crime) utterly odious or wicked.
example: a battery of heinous crimes

definition: an orchestral piece at the beginning of an opera, play, etc.
example: the overture to Mozart's ‘Don Giovanni’

definition: a sudden or violent lunge with a pointed weapon or a bodily part.
example: he drove the blade upwards with one powerful thrust

definition: in an active, quick, or energetic way.
example: she walked briskly into the building

definition: something or someone that one vehemently dislikes.
example: racial hatred was anathema to her

definition: relating to or resembling farce, especially because of absurd or ridiculous aspects.
example: he considered the whole idea farcical

definition: a thing that is helpful or beneficial.
example: the route will be a boon to many travellers

definition: the action of clearing someone of blame or suspicion.
example: I intend to work to ensure my full vindication

definition: a test or record of brain activity produced by electroencephalography.
example: I had an electroencephalogram and a number of other tests

definition: move or cause to move back and forth or from side to side while suspended or on an axis.
example: her long black skirt swung about her legs
synonyms: ['sway', 'oscillate', 'move back and forth', 'move to and fro', 'wave', 'wag', 'dangle', 'rock', 'flutter', 'flap', 'vibrate', 'quiver']

definition: hasty and therefore not thorough or detailed.
example: a cursory glance at the figures

definition: a hard stony substance secreted by certain marine coelenterates as an external skeleton, typically forming large reefs in warm seas.
example: a coral reef

definition: (of a bell or clock) make melodious ringing sounds, typically to indicate the time.
example: the clock chimed eight

definition: cautious and surreptitious action or movement.
example: the silence and stealth of a hungry cat

definition: having great power, influence, or effect.
example: thrones were potent symbols of authority

definition: attach to or cover the end or extremity of.
example: mountains tipped with snow

definition: the unfertilized roe of a lobster or scallop, which is used as food and becomes reddish when cooked.
example: we had scallops with their coral, in their fluted shells

definition: dare to do or say something that may be considered audacious (often used as a polite expression of hesitation or apology).
example: may I venture to add a few comments?
